titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 454: Morte dell'illustrissimo sig. Troilo Savello decapitato in Roma nel Castello Sant' Angelo alli 18 d'aprile 1592

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title (f. 1r); added title page in 19th-century hand: Morte del Baron Troilo Savello, giustiziato in Roma, 1592.

The trial (for murder) is mentioned by L. Pastor in his Geschichte der Päpste (11th ed., p. 619-620) where he refers to an Italian pamphlet on the execution. Biondo's text came out in several English and French editions, but neither the British Museum nor the Bibliothèque nationale (Paris) lists an Italian printed edition (Zacour-Hirsch).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msItem.title: Morte dell'illustrissimo sig. Troilo Savello decapitato in Roma nel Castello Sant' Angelo alli 18 d'aprile 1592

supportDesc.extent: 50 leaves : 196 x 150 (172 x 120) mm. bound to 203 x 157 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 50; [1-50]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by a single hand.

binding.p: Quarter calf with marbled paper and [earlier?] label: Biondo, Suplicio del B.T. Savello.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Conte Paolo Vimercati-Sorzi (bookplate, flyleaf i verso).
Appears in Hoepli catalogs 59 (1890), no. 491, and 83 (1893), no. 17.
